mn134:1.3: Lomasakaṅgiya’s verse speaks of his determination to forge his way through the dense jungle in search of seclusion ([thag1.27]()). He is probably also the same monk who appears in [sn54.12](). His name means “hairy-limbs”.
mn134:2.1: The god Candana, whose name means “sandalwood”, also appears at [dn20:10.5](), [dn32:10.4](), and [sn2:2.15]().
mn134:2.11: This suggests that Candana was one of the Thirty-three. In the Chinese parallels, however, he heard this at Rājagaha. | _Paṇḍukambala_ is a kind of luxury upholstery.
mn134:6.4: Candana is here praised for his skill in learning, yet earlier he says that although he was present when the Buddha taught the “recitation passage and analysis”, he only remembered the verses ([mn134:2.12]()). As at [mn133:6.2](), the parallels are more coherent, as they only mention him hearing the verses.
mn134:8-13.1: The Buddha goes on to repeat the analysis as in [mn131:4.1]()ff.
